data.author: Erik

changelog.release_notes:
- Added a preference toggle for the feature that turns the face to grayscale if Bluetooth is disconnected
- Tentative Diorite support (i.e. it compiles and runs on the emulator). Bug reports welcomed.
Fixed layout when in Quick View (the date is now positioned correctly, and the hands are shortened)
Fixed a bug where the background would flash as the watchface was loading (and remain black in certain cases).

- The settings screen now used the new Clay interface instead of a page hosted on my website. This will make the settings independent of my personal internet connection (or lack thereof).
- Several improvements under the hood
- Should be ready for the new "Quick View" overlay on the Pebble Time, though I have no way to test this ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Fixed a bug where old appointments would remain if there were no new ones
Now keeps the calendar cached. It still loads an update, but the watchface doesn't look "empty" initially.
Added a pie chart feature, enabled by setting appointment circle and appointments to the same color
The date now moves around to avoid being covered by the clock hands.
- Fixed an error where the date would have the wrong color, and the color setting for date didn't have any effect
Fixed a problem where the watchface would ignore the background color setting.

data.description:
View your calendar at a glance! Link any number of Google Calendars to have your appointments appear as markers along your watch's edge. Full color customization is supported.

Currently, the free/busy information from your Google Calendar must be public for this watchface to work. You can make that happen in the calendar's settings.

latest_release.release_notes:
- Added a preference toggle for the feature that turns the face to grayscale if Bluetooth is disconnected
- Tentative Diorite support (i.e. it compiles and runs on the emulator). Bug reports welcomed.

data.title: Full Circle
